bugs.title: CVE-2017-17810 nasm: Segfault via mishandled macro calls in asm/preproc.c

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2017-17810 nasm: Segfault via mishandled macro calls in asm/preproc.c

long_desc.thetext:
In Netwide Assembler (NASM) 2.14rc0, there is a "SEGV on unknown address" that will cause a denial of service attack, because asm/preproc.c mishandles macro calls that have the wrong number of arguments.

Upstream bug:

https://bugzilla.nasm.us/show_bug.cgi?id=3392431

Upstream patch:

http://repo.or.cz/nasm.git/commit/59ce1c67b16967c652765e62aa130b7e43f21dd4

Created nasm tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 1529336]

bugs.title: CVE-2017-17811 nasm: Heap-based buffer overflow in paste_tokens function in asm/preproc.c

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2017-17811 nasm: Heap-based buffer overflow in paste_tokens function in asm/preproc.c

long_desc.thetext:
In Netwide Assembler (NASM) 2.14rc0, there is a heap-based buffer overflow that will cause a denial of service attack, related to a strcpy in paste_tokens in asm/preproc.c, a similar issue to CVE-2017-11111.

Upstream bug:

https://bugzilla.nasm.us/show_bug.cgi?id=3392432

Created nasm tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 1529336]

bugs.title: CVE-2017-17812 nasm: Heap-based buffer over-read in detoken function in asm/preproc.c

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2017-17812 nasm: Heap-based buffer over-read in detoken function in asm/preproc.c

long_desc.thetext:
In Netwide Assembler (NASM) 2.14rc0, there is a heap-based buffer over-read in the function detoken() in asm/preproc.c that will cause a denial of service attack.

Upstream bug:

https://bugzilla.nasm.us/show_bug.cgi?id=3392424

Upstream patch:

http://repo.or.cz/nasm.git/commit/9b7ee09abfd426b99aa1ea81d19a3b2818eeabf9

Created nasm tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 1529336]

bugs.title: CVE-2017-17813 nasm: use-after-free in pp_list_one_macro function in asm/preproc.c

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2017-17813 nasm: use-after-free in pp_list_one_macro function in asm/preproc.c

long_desc.thetext:
In Netwide Assembler (NASM) 2.14rc0, there is a use-after-free in the pp_list_one_macro function in asm/preproc.c that will cause a denial of service attack, related to mishandling of line-syntax errors.

Upstream bug:

https://bugzilla.nasm.us/show_bug.cgi?id=3392429

Created nasm tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 1529336]

bugs.title: CVE-2017-17814 nasm: use-after-free in do_directive function in asm/preproc.c

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2017-17814 nasm: use-after-free in do_directive function in asm/preproc.c

long_desc.thetext:
In Netwide Assembler (NASM) 2.14rc0, there is a use-after-free in do_directive in asm/preproc.c that will cause a denial of service.

Upstream bug:

https://bugzilla.nasm.us/show_bug.cgi?id=3392430

Created nasm tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 1529336]

bugs.title: CVE-2017-17815 nasm: Illegal address access in is_mmacro function in asm/preproc.c

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2017-17815 nasm: Illegal address access in is_mmacro function in asm/preproc.c

long_desc.thetext:
In Netwide Assembler (NASM) 2.14rc0, there is an illegal address access in is_mmacro() in asm/preproc.c that will cause denial of service, because of a missing check for the relationship between minimum and maximum parameter counts.

Upstream bug:

https://bugzilla.nasm.us/show_bug.cgi?id=3392436

Upstream patch:

http://repo.or.cz/nasm.git/commit/c9244eaadd05b27637cde06021bac3fa1d920aa3

Created nasm tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 1529336]

bugs.title: CVE-2017-17816 nasm: Use-after-free in pp_getline function in asm/preproc.c

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2017-17816 nasm: Use-after-free in pp_getline function in asm/preproc.c

long_desc.thetext:
In Netwide Assembler (NASM) 2.14rc0, there is a use-after-free in pp_getline in asm/preproc.c that will cause a denial of service.

Upstream bug:

https://bugzilla.nasm.us/show_bug.cgi?id=3392426

Created nasm tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 1529336]

bugs.title: CVE-2017-17817 nasm: Use-after-free in pp_verror function in asm/preproc.c

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2017-17817 nasm: Use-after-free in pp_verror function in asm/preproc.c

long_desc.thetext:
In Netwide Assembler (NASM) 2.14rc0, there is a use-after-free in pp_verror in asm/preproc.c that will cause denial of service.

Upstream bug:

https://bugzilla.nasm.us/show_bug.cgi?id=3392427

Created nasm tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 1529336]

bugs.title: CVE-2017-17818 nasm: Heap-based buffer over-read in paste_tokens function in asm/preproc.c

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2017-17818 nasm: Heap-based buffer over-read in paste_tokens function in asm/preproc.c

long_desc.thetext:
In Netwide Assembler (NASM) 2.14rc0, there is a heap-based buffer over-read that will cause denial of service, related to a while loop in paste_tokens in asm/preproc.c.

Upstream bug:

https://bugzilla.nasm.us/show_bug.cgi?id=3392428

Created nasm tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 1529336]

bugs.title: CVE-2017-17819 nasm: Illegal address access in find_cc function in asm/preproc.c

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2017-17819 nasm: Illegal address access in find_cc function in asm/preproc.c

long_desc.thetext:
In Netwide Assembler (NASM) 2.14rc0, there is an illegal address access in the function find_cc() in asm/preproc.c that will cause denial of service, because pointers associated with skip_white_ calls are not validated.

Upstream bug:

https://bugzilla.nasm.us/show_bug.cgi?id=3392435

Upstream patch:

http://repo.or.cz/nasm.git/commit/7524cfd91492e6e3719b959498be584a9ced13af

Created nasm tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 1529336]

bugs.title: CVE-2017-17820 nasm: Use-after-free in pp_list_one_macro function in asm/preproc.c

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2017-17820 nasm: Use-after-free in pp_list_one_macro function in asm/preproc.c

long_desc.thetext:
In Netwide Assembler (NASM) 2.14rc0, there is a use-after-free in pp_list_one_macro in asm/preproc.c that will lead to denial of service, related to mishandling of operand-type errors.

Upstream bug:

https://bugzilla.nasm.us/show_bug.cgi?id=3392433

Created nasm tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 1529336]

Affects: fedora-all [bug 1529336]

This is an automatically created tracking bug!  It was created to ensure
that one or more security vulnerabilities are fixed in affected versions
of fedora-all.

For comments that are specific to the vulnerability please use bugs filed
against the "Security Response" product referenced in the "Blocks" field.

For more information see:
http://fedoraproject.org/wiki/Security/TrackingBugs

When submitting as an update, use the fedpkg template provided in the next
comment(s).  This will include the bug IDs of this tracking bug as well as
the relevant top-level CVE bugs.

Please also mention the CVE IDs being fixed in the RPM changelog and the
fedpkg commit message.

NOTE: this issue affects multiple supported versions of Fedora. While only
one tracking bug has been filed, please correct all affected versions at
the same time.  If you need to fix the versions independent of each other,
you may clone this bug as appropriate.

Use the following template to for the 'fedpkg update' request to submit an
update for this issue as it contains the top-level parent bug(s) as well as
this tracking bug.  This will ensure that all associated bugs get updated
when new packages are pushed to stable.

=====

# bugfix, security, enhancement, newpackage (required)
type=security

# testing, stable
request=testing

# Bug numbers: 1234,9876
bugs=1529312,1529317,1529319,1529326,1529327,1529328,1529330,1529331,1529332,1529334,1529335,1529336

# Description of your update
notes=Security fix for [PUT CVEs HERE]

# Enable request automation based on the stable/unstable karma thresholds
autokarma=True
stable_karma=3
unstable_karma=-3

# Automatically close bugs when this marked as stable
close_bugs=True

# Suggest that users restart after update
suggest_reboot=False

======

Additionally, you may opt to use the bodhi web interface to submit updates:

https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/new
